body:
Thanks. I'll try to reproduce this today.
On 10 Aug 2015 8:44 am, "Tobias Schwab" <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> This is how I can reproduce it:
>
> $ echo $GOROOT
> /home/tobias/go/current
>
> $ cat main.go
> package main
>
> func main() {
>           print("hello world\n")
> }
>
> $ go version
> go version go1.5rc1 linux/amd64
> $ GOARM=6 GOARCH=arm go build -o ./ts-pi-cc
> $ file ./ts-pi-cc
> ./ts-pi-cc: ELF 32-bit LSB executable, ARM, EABI5 version 1 (SYSV), statically linked, not stripped
> $ cat ./ts-pi-cc | ssh pi@192.168.178.36 "cat - > ts-pi-cc && chmod a+x ts-pi-cc && ./ts-pi-cc"
> bash: line 1:  1890 Illegal instruction     ./ts-pi-cc
>
> $ ln -nfs ~/go/go1.4.2 ~/go/current
> $ go version
> go version go1.4.2 linux/amd64
> $ GOARM=6 GOARCH=arm go build -o ./ts-pi-cc
> $ file ./ts-pi-cc
> ./ts-pi-cc: ELF 32-bit LSB executable, ARM, EABI5 version 1 (SYSV), statically linked, not stripped
> $ cat ./ts-pi-cc | ssh pi@192.168.178.36 "cat - > ts-pi-cc && chmod a+x ts-pi-cc && ./ts-pi-cc"
> Hello world
>
> â€”
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/golang/go/issues/12087#issuecomment-129258210>.
>
